subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] PCB software
author: Zack Widup
full_text:
I know what you mean about the excitement. I've spent a lot of long nights 
working on something and not even realizing what time it was!

The good thing about my pcb making is that I can make as many or as few 
as I want. I've tried making them in batches, where I make maybe 4 at a 
time, and depending on the size of the board it can take the same amount 
of time as to make one.

A friend of mine got his hands on some "experimental" NiMH AA-size 
batteries that were supposed to be good for 3500 or 4000 mAh.  He said 
he was told they were a bit unstable and could possibly explode when 
being used. I guess that's why they were experimental.  But once they get 
the bugs worked out, these might be a good source of power.

Zack

On Wed, 9 Apr 2008, Frank Sumption wrote:

>
> http://www.freepcb.com/
>
> This might work and the price is right. I actaully have two boards I want to make, the sweep board, and the AM tuner board. Then I might want to make a complete board, tuner and all. I was working on a board made to fit a RS project box, so the sides taper slightly. I had to make two seprate boards, the sweep is on a smaller daughter board-both using perf board.
>
> I hate it when that excitement starts setting in! It usually means days without sleep.
>
> BTW, I don't think I would want 30 of any given board, all at once anyway, but would want them available to others--they can order their own(?)
>
>  The next problem is power, using the AA-8 packs is kind of poor, sometimes they melt down, and the life isn't long enough. 1.2ah gel cells are good, but pricy. $50 just for batteries. The boxes require a + and - supply, or two 12 volt batteries.
>
> Frank-S
